Q:

Git: Pushing a file to another directory?

I want to git push a file to another directory and push the file as root. I tried writing the following code:
$ git push git@github.com:twitter.com:git/

but it failed. What could I do?

A:

You do not need to have a user account. The git user name is just a user account name.
$ git push --tags --all
Hello, this is the name of the git user account.
$ git push -u tj@github.com
$ git push --tags --all
Hello, this is the name of the git user account.
$ git push -u tj@github.com
$ git push -u tj@github.com
